Module com.example.main
Package com.example.main

Class Query

java.lang.Object
com.example.main.Query
public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
This class controls the queries made to the database.

      public Query()

  • Method Details

    • queryDB

      public static java.sql.ResultSet queryDB​(java.lang.String queryCode)
      This method takes a query in the form of a string and uses it to query the database.
      Parameters:
      queryCode - This is the string that will be used to query the database.

    • addToQueryDB

      public static java.sql.ResultSet addToQueryDB​(int id, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.String locate, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String startDate, java.lang.String endDate, java.lang.String create_date, java.lang.String created_by, java.lang.String last_update, java.lang.String last_updated_by, int customer_id, int user_id, int contact_id)
      This method takes arguments and uses them to add a new appointment row in the database. This method is also used when modifying appointments.
      Parameters:
      id - the appointment_id to be added.
      title - the title of the appointment.
      desc - the description of the appointment.
      locate - the location of the appointment.
      type - the type of appointment being added.
      startDate - the date and time the appointment will begin.
      endDate - the date and time the appointment will end.
      create_date - the date and time the appointment was created.
      created_by - the user that created the appointment initially.
      last_update - the last time this appointment has been updated.
      last_updated_by - the last user to have updated this appointment.
      customer_id - the customer ID linked to this appointment.
      contact_id - the contact that can be called for this appointment.
      user_id - the user ID that created this appointment.

    • addCustomerToQueryDB

      public static java.sql.ResultSet addCustomerToQueryDB​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String postalCode, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String create_date, java.lang.String created_by, java.lang.String last_update, java.lang.String last_updated_by, int division_id)
      This method takes arguments and uses them to add a new customer row in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - the customer_id to be added.
      name - the customer name to be added.
      phone - the customer phone number.
      address - the customer address to be added.
      division_id - the division_id linked to the customer.
      postalCode - the postal code linked to the customer.
      create_date - the date and time the customer was created.
      created_by - the user that created the customer initially.
      last_update - the last time this customer has been updated.
      last_updated_by - the last user to have updated this customer.

    • modifyCustomerToQueryDB

      public static void modifyCustomerToQueryDB​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String postal, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String createDate, java.lang.String createdBy, java.lang.String update, java.lang.String updatedBy, int divisionId)
      This method takes arguments and uses them to modify the matching customer row in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - the customer_id to be added.
      name - the customer name to be added.
      phone - the customer phone number.
      address - the customer address to be added.
      divisionId - the division_id linked to the customer.
      postal - the postal code linked to the customer.
      createDate - the date and time the customer was created.
      createdBy - the user that created the customer initially.
      update - the last time this customer has been updated.
      updatedBy - the last user to have updated this customer.

    • deleteQueryDB

      public static java.sql.ResultSet deleteQueryDB​(java.lang.String queryCode)
      This method is used when the user needs to delete a row from the database.
      Parameters:
      queryCode - This is the string that will be used to query the database.
